page.title: 02The Church at Langford.
page.content: St.Matthew's (C of E) Church displays some of the best Saxon architecture in England. It was built over a thousand years ago. It has a tower which is entirely Anglo-Saxon. There is a figure of Christ in Majesty which dates from before the Norman Conquest and is known as the Langford Rood. Services are held every Sunday at 18.00hrs. About twenty people come to the meetings.They do not have a Sunday School because they are unable to find anyone to organise it. There is no choir. There have been three weddings in the first six months of 1985. The school sometimes uses the church. There are three volunteer ladies who clean the church and are unpaid.The vicar and his wife live in the vicarage opposite the church.There are six bells in the tower which are only played on special occasions.
